00016 
00017 package WeBWorK::Utils::RestrictedMailer;
00018 use base "Mail::Sender";
00019 
00020 =for comment
00021 
00022 PLEASE NOTE
00023 
00024 This class does not impose any restrictions on its own, it simply provides
00025 restricted versions of Mail::Sender's Open, OpenMultipart, MailMsg, and
00026 MailFile methods.
00027 
00028 The restricted methods prevent the caller from overriding parameters that
00029 have already been specified to the constructor. For example, if the "smtp"
00030 parameter is specified in new(), it cannot be re-specified in Open(). To lock
00031 a parameter without specifying a value, set it to undef.
00032 
00033 To avoid having to list all possible parameters to lock them, specify
00034 lock_by_default=>1. To allow a locked parameter to be changed, list it in
00035 allow_change.
00036 
00037 To restrict the recipients that are allowed, list those recipients in
00038 allowed_recipients.
00039 
00040 By wrapping an instance of this class with RestrictedClosureClass, you can
00041 prevent the user from changing the SMTP server settings and sending mail to
00042 or from unauthorized addresses.
00043 
00044 Method summary:
00045  - new (wrapped) - safe
00046  - Open (wrapped) - safe
00047  - OpenMultipart (wrapped) - safe
00048  - MailMsg (wrapped) - safe
00049  - MailFile (wrapped) - unsafe, allows read access to filesystem
00050  - Send - unsafe, can be used to issue SMTP commands
00051  - SendLine - unsafe, can be used to issue SMTP commands
00052  - print/SendEnc - safe
00053  - SendLineEnc - safe
00054  - SendEx - unsafe, can be used to issue SMTP commands
00055  - SendLineEx - unsafe, can be used to issue SMTP commands
00056  - Part - safe, but params cannot be locked
00057  - Body - safe, but params cannot be locked
00058  - SendFile/Attach - unsafe, allows read access to filesystem
00059  - EndPart - safe
00060  - Close - safe, but allows overriding the keepconnection parameter
00061  - Cancel - safe
00062  - QueryAuthProtocols - unsafe, allows connection to arbitrary SMTP server
00063  - GetHandle - safe
00064 
00065 FIXME MailFile needs restriction on what files can be specified.
00066 
00067 FIXME There's currently no way to restrict the arguments to Part, Body, or
00068 SendFile/Attach, but the only time this is actually a problem is with the "file"
00069 parameter to SendFile/Attach.
00070 
00071 FIXME What about ctype and charset, which appear as params to new and also
00072 appear separately as params to MailFile, Part, Body, and SendFile/Attach?
00073 
00074 FIXME Close should check if keepconnection is locked.
00075 
00076 FIXME QueryAuthProtocols could be made safe by prohibiting the $smtpserver
00077 argument.
00078 
00079 =cut
00080 
00081 use strict;
00082 use warnings;
00083 use Carp;
00084 use Scalar::Util qw/refaddr/;
00085 use Storable qw/dclone/;
00086 use WeBWorK::Utils qw/constituency_hash/;
00087 
00088 # params that all methods accept
00089 our @COMMON_PARAMS = qw/from fake_from reply replyto to fake_to cc fake_cc bcc
00090 smtp subject headers boundary multipart ctype charset client priority confirm
00091 debug debug_level auth authid authdomain auth_encoded keepconnection
00092 skip_bad_recipients createmessageid onerrors/;
00093 
00094 # params accepted by each method we're restricting
00095 our %LEGAL_PARAMS = (
00096     new => constituency_hash(@COMMON_PARAMS),
00097     Open => constituency_hash(@COMMON_PARAMS),
00098     OpenMultipart => constituency_hash(@COMMON_PARAMS),
00099     MailMsg => constituency_hash(@COMMON_PARAMS, qw/msg/),
00100     MailFile => constituency_hash(@COMMON_PARAMS, qw/msg file description ctype charset encoding/),
00101     #Part => constituency_hash(qw/description ctype encoding disposition content_id msg charset/),
00102     Body => constituency_hash(qw/charset encoding ctype msg/),
00103     Attach => constituency_hash(qw/description ctype encoding disposition file content_id/),
00104 );
00105 
00106 # order of positional params
00107 our %POSITIONAL_PARAMS = (
00108     new => [qw/from reply to smtp subject headers boundary/],
00109     Open => [qw/from reply to smtp subject headers/],
00110     OpenMultipart => [qw/from reply to smtp subject headers boundary/],
00111     MailMsg => [qw/from reply to smtp subject headers msg/],
00112     MailFile => [qw/from reply to smtp subject headers msg file description/],
00113     #Part => [qw/description ctype encoding disposition content_id msg/],
00114     #Body => [qw/charset encoding ctype/],
00115     #Attach => [qw/description ctype encoding disposition file/],
00116 );
00117 
00118 # legal opts:
00119 #   - params (parameters to pass to SUPER::new, either as an arrayref of positional params or as hashref)
00120 #   - lock_by_default (if true, params not listed in params or allow_change will be locked)
00121 #   - allow_change (params listed here will always be changeable)
00122 #   - allowed_recipients (if non-empty, recipient addresses must be in this list)
00123 #   - fatal_errors (if true, attempts to modify locked params will cause an exception)
00124 # 
00125 sub new {
00126     my ($invocant, %opts) = @_;
00127     
00128     my $params = $opts{params};
00129     $params = munge_params("new", @$params) if ref $params eq "ARRAY";
00130     
00131     # make a deep copy of the params that will be passed to new
00132     # Mail::Sender might delete some elements, and we need the whole thing for later comparison
00133     my $initial_params = dclone $params;
00134     
00135     # create the object, passing the params in
00136     my $self = $invocant->SUPER::new($params);
00137     
00138     # handle errors
00139     die $Mail::Sender::Error unless ref $self;
00140     
00141     # store the set of initial params for later perusal
00142     $self->initial_params = $initial_params;
00143     
00144     # lock_by_default states that params listed neither in params nor in allow_change should be locked
00145     $self->lock_by_default = $opts{lock_by_default};
00146     
00147     # allow_change lists params that can be changed even if they appear in params OR lock_by_default is true
00148     # (this is stored as a HASH with undefined values for easy constituency testing)
00149     $self->allow_change = constituency_hash(@{$opts{allow_change}});
00150     
00151     # allowed_recipients can't be handled by setting an initial param
00152     $self->allowed_recipients = constituency_hash(@{$opts{allowed_recipients}});
00153     
00154     # fatal_errors will generate exceptions when locked params are changed
00155     # (otherwise, the changes are ignored and a warning is issued)
00156     $self->fatal_errors = $opts{fatal_errors};
00157     
00158     return $self;
00159 }
00160 
00161 sub Open {
00162     my $self = shift;
00163     my $params = munge_params("Open", @_);
00164     $self->filter_params("Open", $params);
00165     warn "this is Open: self=$self ISA=@WeBWorK::Utils::RestrictedMailer::ISA";
00166     return $self->SUPER::Open($params);
00167 }
00168 
00169 sub OpenMultipart {
00170     my $self = shift;
00171     my $params = munge_params("OpenMultipart", @_);
00172     $self->filter_params("OpenMultipart", $params);
00173     return $self->SUPER::Open($params);
00174 }
00175 
00176 sub MailMsg {
00177     my $self = shift;
00178     my $params = munge_params("MailMsg", @_);
00179     $self->filter_params("MailMsg", $params);
00180     return $self->SUPER::MailMsg($params);
00181 }
00182 
00183 sub MailFile {
00184     my $self = shift;
00185     my $params = munge_params("MailFile", @_);
00186     $self->filter_params("MailFile", $params);
00187     return $self->SUPER::MailFile($params);
00188 }
00189 
00190 sub _prepare_addresses {
00191     my ($self, $type) = @_;
00192     $self->SUPER::_prepare_addresses($type);
00193     foreach my $address (@{$self->{'to_list'}}, @{$self->{'cc_list'}}, @{$self->{'bcc_list'}}) {
00194         $address = $1 if $address =~ /<(.*)>/;
00195         croak "mail not permitted to '$address'" unless exists $self->allowed_recipients->{$address};
00196     }
00197 }
00198 
00199 ################################################################################
00200 
00201 # prefix for the keys we're adding to $self
00202 our $PREFIX = "WeBWorK_Utils_RestrictedMailer_";
00203 
00204 sub initial_params     : lvalue { shift->{$PREFIX."initial_params"} }
00205 sub lock_by_default    : lvalue { shift->{$PREFIX."lock_by_default"} }
00206 sub allow_change       : lvalue { shift->{$PREFIX."allow_change"} }
00207 sub allowed_recipients : lvalue { shift->{$PREFIX."allowed_recipients"} }
00208 sub fatal_errors       : lvalue { shift->{$PREFIX."fatal_errors"} }
00209 
00210 sub skipped_recipients { return shift->{skipped_recipients} }
00211 sub error              { return shift->{error} }
00212 sub error_msg          { return shift->{error_msg} }
00213 
00214 sub carp_or_croak { shift->fatal_errors ? croak @_ : carp @_ }
00215 
00216 sub munge_params {
00217     my ($sub, @params) = @_;
00218     
00219     my $hash;
00220     if (@params) {
00221         if (ref $params[0] eq "HASH") {
00222             $hash = $params[0];
00223         } else {
00224             my @names = @{$POSITIONAL_PARAMS{$sub}};
00225             my $max = $#names < $#params ? $#names : $#params;
00226             @$hash{@names[0..$max]} = @params[0..$max];
00227         }
00228     }
00229     return $hash || {};
00230 }
00231 
00232 sub filter_params {
00233     my ($self, $sub, $params) = @_;
00234     
00235     foreach my $param (keys %$params) {
00236         if (exists $LEGAL_PARAMS{$sub}{$param}) {
00237             next if exists $self->{$PREFIX."allow_change"}{$param};
00238             if (exists $self->{$PREFIX."initial_params"}{$param}) {
00239                 my $oldval = $self->{$PREFIX."initial_params"}{$param};
00240                 my $newval = $params->{$param};
00241                 next if deq($oldval, $newval);
00242                 $self->carp_or_croak("failed to set param '$param' in method '$sub': param is locked");
00243                 delete $params->{$param};
00244             } elsif ($self->{$PREFIX."lock_by_default"}) {
00245                 $self->carp_or_croak("failed to change param '$param' in method '$sub': param is locked");
00246                 delete $params->{$param};
00247             }
00248         } else {
00249             $self->carp_or_croak("invalid param '$param' in method '$sub'");
00250             delete $params->{$param};
00251         }
00252     }
00253 }
00254 
00255 sub deq {
00256     my ($oldval, $newval) = @_;
00257     
00258     #print "oldval=$oldval newval=$newval\n";
00259     if (ref $oldval and ref $newval) {
00260         if (ref $oldval eq ref $newval) {
00261             my $reftype = ref $oldval;
00262             if ($reftype eq "HASH") {
00263                 my @oldkeys = sort keys %$oldval;
00264                 my @newkeys = sort keys %$newval;
00265                 #print "oldkeys=@oldkeys\n";
00266                 #print "newkeys=@newkeys\n";
00267                 return 0 unless deq(\@oldkeys, \@newkeys);
00268                 my @oldvals = @$oldval{@oldkeys};
00269                 my @newvals = @$newval{@newkeys};
00270                 #print "oldvals=@oldvals\n";
00271                 #print "newvals=@newvals\n";
00272                 return deq(\@oldvals, \@newvals);
00273             } elsif ($reftype eq "ARRAY") {
00274                 return 0 unless @$oldval == @$newval;
00275                 for (my $i = 0; $i < @$oldval; $i++) {
00276                     return 0 unless deq($oldval->[$i], $newval->[$i]);
00277                 }
00278                 return 1;
00279             } elsif ($reftype eq "SCALAR") {
00280                 return deq($$oldval, $$newval);
00281             } elsif ($reftype eq "CODE") {
00282                 # the best we can do here is compare the addresses
00283                 return refaddr $oldval == refaddr $newval;
00284             } else {
00285                 warn "unsupported reftype '$reftype' in deq()";
00286                 return 0;
00287             }
00288         } else {
00289             return 0;
00290         }
00291     } elsif (ref $oldval) {
00292         return 0;
00293     } elsif (ref $newval) {
00294         return 0;
00295     } else {
00296         if (defined $oldval and defined $newval) {
00297             return $oldval eq $newval;
00298         } elsif (not defined $oldval and not defined $newval) {
00299             return 1;
00300         } else {
00301             return 0;
00302         }
00303     }
00304 }
00305 
00306 1;
